Research.Name: Metadata Shaping: Natural Language Annotations for the Tail
Research.Title: Metadata Shaping:  Natural Language Annotations for the Tail
Research.Authors: S. Arora, S. Wu, E. Liu, C. Ré
Research.Description: To what extent can we match architectural modifications to incorporate domain knowledge, using only simple modifications to the data? And how can we understand why the data modifications will be effective?

Research.Name: Bootleg
Research.Title: Bootleg: Chasing the Tail with Self-Supervised Named Entity Disambiguation
Research.Authors: L. Orr*, M. Leszczynski*, N. Guha, S. Wu, S. Arora, X. Ling, C. Ré
Research.Description: Bootleg is a self-supervised named entity disambiguation (NED) system that links mentions in text to entities in a knowledge base. Bootleg is built to improve disambiguation of entities which appear infrequently or not at all in training data, called tail entities.

Research.Name: Contextual Embeddings
Research.Title: Contextual Embeddings: When Are They Worth It?
Research.Authors: S. Arora*, A. May*, J. Zhang, C. Ré
Research.Description: When contextual embeddings are worth their cost, versus when it is possible to use more efficient word representations without significant degradation in performance?

Research.Name: GraphRex
Research.Title: Optimizing Declarative Graph Queries at Large Scale
Research.Authors: Q Zhang, A Acharya, H Chen, S Arora, A Chen, V Liu, BT Loo
Research.Description: This paper presents GraphRex, an efficient, robust, scalable, and easy-to-program framework for graph processing on datacenter infrastructure.

Research.Name: Microrobot Control
Research.Title: Control of multiple microrobots with multiscale magnetic field superposition
Research.Authors: E Steager, D Wong, J Wang, S Arora, V Kumar

Details.detailType: Paper *top 3 finalist for best conference paper

Research.Description: Controlled independent manipulation of multiple objects at cellular length scales in an open challenge with potential applications in life sciences (e.g. directed drug delivery), microsurgery and advanced manufacturing. Magnetism has been studied as a means to perform such fine scale manipulation, but generating fields that discriminate between targets at small length scales is nontrivial. We present a system for simultaneous control of multiple magnetic microrobots with characteristic lengths on the order of 10 μνα, which is based on the superposition of magnetic fields generated at centimeter scale (global) as well as micrometer scale (local).

Research.Name: DASA Photoswitch Molecule 2
Research.Title: A temperature-mapping molecular sensor for polyurethane-based elastomers
Research.Authors: B. P. Mason, M. Whittaker, J. Hemmer, S. Arora, A. Harper, S. Alnemrat, A. McEachen, S. Helmy, J. Read de Alaniz, and J. P. Hooper
Research.Description: This work focuses on the physics of the HTPB polymer, which is widely used in United States Naval explosives and rocket motor formulations. These composites are often subjected to extreme temperatures, shocks, and pressures in the field, which has led to disasterous unintended detonations. Methods to better understand the behavior of these composites are highly desirable - this work presents a method for analyzing temperature localization in these composites with submicron spatial resolution.

Research.Name: DASA Photoswitch Molecule 1
Research.Title: Thermochromic polymers as in-situ sensors for hot spots in explosive composites.
Research.Authors: J. P. Hooper, J. R. Hemmer, B. P. Mason, S. Alnemrat, M. Whittaker, S. Arora, S. Helmy, and J. Read de Alaniz.

Projects.Title: Peer-3-Peer: Disaster Proof Offline Messaging
Projects.Authors: S. Arora, J. Barton, B. Judd, R. Rao, D. Wang (Advised by Prof. Vincent Liu)

LocalDetails.detailType: Presentation *2nd Place in Penn CS Senior Design Competition

Projects.Description: Peer-3-Peer is a robust offline communication ecosystem that provides civilians, aid organizations, and governments with reliable messaging when cellular and internet access are unavailable.
